column4: how do I diagnose why my network just stopped working on my ubuntu all of the sudden (using active windows computer on network now)
please pm me if you can help
best to keep questions in channel as you'll get more help. is it wired or wireless?
my network connection is wired
open a terminal and type 'ifconfig'
do you want me to pastebin?
nothing yet. is there anything under inet address?
did you get that last one?
k. well let's see if the router is talking to you. let's ask for an ip address 'sudo dhclient eth1' (if it's on eth1 it may be eth0)
what do you want to know?
did you run the 'sudo dhclient eth0' ?
yes
it said that there's no dhcpoffers received
Ah. but when you then run ifconfig does it still have an ip address?
I've manually config'd my computer for that ip because my Buffalo isn't running DHCP - only my Netgear is (remember It's a wirelss bridge)
well you may have set that statically. did you?
yes  - i should tell you I have an eth0:avah showing up?  it seems to be getting a 169.x.x.x ip
Ah.
yessum.
You have a route problem.
I'm not sure what you've got. I don't remember reading about a "(remember It's a wirelss bridge)"
not left to yourself. you will need to outline the problem a bit more.
